reviews.review_msg:
Josip is the best. Super engaging classes: a combo of group discussions, mini-lectures, videos, etc. so its always interesting but no one is forced to participate. 

Gives incredibly clear assignment guidelines and is a very generous marker if you follow his instructions. Very kind, chill, funny, but super intelligent and an excellent teacher.

Jason has an extensive background within the field of international relations and his experience comes from work that he did in the Congo. He is extremely knowledgeable and it shows. His course conduct was excellent. Given that we were in the middle of a pandemic he altered the class structure so as to not place extra burden on us. Very caring.

One of the most frustrating courses I've taken. Grading felt arbitrary, with feedback that contradicted the rubric. Lectures felt aimless yet dense. Unclear expectations and no chance to revise grading a 50% weighted paper. Participation and presentation marks were vague. The lowest point in an otherwise positive experience in IS. Avoid entirely.

Try to avoid if possible, she is an extremely unfair marker I am an A student and i have never done poorly on a paper. Until this class her expectations are unattainable. While she is nice and approachable she can give too many ways to do a paper and then mark based off of something else. She weighted the paper at 50%the class average was not high

Jemima is an engaging speaker and is nice enough. However, she is an AWFUL professor. I am an A+ student and I almost failed our final project worth 50% because she deducted marks for random reasons. Grade: 20% participation, 30% group presentation, and 50% final project. Everyone was fighting for a participation mark and we learned very little.
